page.title: 09The Post Office
page.content: July 1985 is the 350th Anniversary of the Post Office Royal Mail Service. The Post Office for the Roding's area is in Leaden Roding, at the house called Queen's Cottage, but it has only been there a few months. For the previous 20 years it had been in in a house in Holloway Crescent, and for 2 or 3 years before that it was in Coombe Cottage, Leaden Roding. There used to be Post Offices in White Roding, High Roding and Willingale, but these have all closed down now. My mummy is the Post Mistress at Leaden Roding. She sells postage stamps and air letters to send abroad. You can post parcels and you can buy Dog and Television Liscences. She also sells Travellers Cheques to take on holiday but she can't buy them back, you have to take them to a bank.
